course.subject: LIFS
course.name: Microbiology Laboratory
course.description: Tutorial and practical instruction on cultivation, differentiation, and identification of microorganisms, determination of microbial numbers, sterilization, disinfection, antimicrobials, and the prevalence of microorganisms in the body and environment will be covered. Graded P or F.

reviews.author: Rossy
reviews.title: Nice professor with very good teaching
reviews.comment_content:
-Some biochemical testing on bacteria
- Practical skill test included

The lab was quite fun because there would be a lot of unexpected and colourful results.

Going to all the labs and tutorial is a must! Most of the teachings have to be included in the lab report and will be tested in the exam.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The Professor is very nice and patients in answering all questions. He won't tell you the answer straight away but he will slowly lead you to the answer.

He would also demonstrate the entire lab once before we actually perform it ourselves.

It is a pretty small class with only 20 studetnts, so we have more chances to practice and gain much hand-on experience. He also gave us much chances and time to do the practical skills.
reviews.comment_grading:
It was an absolute grading. For me, I got 85%, which is A. You can do the calculation of how grades are calculated.

Getting an A is not hard but you really have to be hard working. There are 4 reports in total. You have to write in details in order to get 90 percent. I wrote around 20 pages for each lab report.

You dun have to think about what to write because all the questions are listed in the lab manual. All you have to do is answer them all with details and reference.

As for the exam, it is pretty much the results of the labs. If you have done the reports with heart, it would be easy. It would be much better if you took microbiology at the same time because most contents are overlapped.
reviews.comment_workload:
- 3 lab reports
- 1 project
The project is about figuring out the which bacteria you are testing based on the results you have got. The professor will tell you when your tests results was wrong.

- final exam

reviews.author: 黃銘
reviews.comment_content: The materials covered basics mentioned in LIFS3060, alongside with aseptic laboratory techniques, which are easy for an average life science undergraduate to handle. There was not much demand on memorising for a life science course, the identification of microbes was done with sufficient resources and identification keys. It makes the course focus more heavily on students' skills.
reviews.comment_teaching: Although the pace of speech was a bit slow, the necessary contents were taught clearly without too much sidetracking. The instructors were kind and patient enough to reply any question you raise during lab sections and tutorials.
reviews.comment_grading: Absolute grading was adapted, which makes the grade reasonably good and reflects students' effort appropriately. The 6 lab reports contributes the most important part, as the final exam was not meant to be hard.
reviews.comment_workload:
There were 6 experiments in total, each takes 1 to 2 weeks. An abstract report was required for each experiment, in soft-copy. The laboratory manual contains questions to answer/include for the lab report and the report shall contain photos (which you can take in-class).
I did average of 15 pages and took 2 days each. I overachieved the requirement so 15 pages were much more than enough.

reviews.author: Daniel's
reviews.title: Practical skills learnt + Very nice professor
reviews.comment_content:
Teaches a lot of skills required for microbiology lab. Very useful if you would like to pursue a career in medical lab or anything similar.

Syllabus:
Topic 1 Culture & Isolation of Microbes
Topic 2 Antimicrobials & Sterilisation
Topic 3 Visualisation of Microbial Cells
Topic 4 (2 weeks) Identification & Characterisation of Microbes
Topic 5 (2 weeks) Viruses
Class Project (~2 weeks)

Some practical skills you will learn after all the labs
1. Streak Plate method
2. Pour plate method
3. Inoculate plates using Glass rod/ swap/ loop
4. Gram Stain
5. Serial Dilution
6. ~Wet mount10 different biochemistry tests
7. Use of ELISA
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Hung is very experienced in teaching this course, one could go to him when one encounter any unusual results and he could usually give you somewhat of a explanation what is happening to your test result.
Dr Hung also explain concept and lab skills in a very detailed manner, and are usually easy to understand. But sometimes it might be a little boring as he usually spend the first 1 hour of lab and an 1hour briefing session to brief us about the experiment + doing some demonstration.
reviews.comment_grading:
P/F
As long as you work normally you will get a pass.
And do be punctual for all sessions.
reviews.comment_workload:
Writing total of 8 short "lab reports"
each for around 2-3 pages with photos, so not a huge workload.
Usually Dr. Hung need us to present the result of the experiment and do some analysis on it. Not very difficult nor demanding.

reviews.author: RichardY
reviews.comment_content:
Content covers:
1. Basic microbial experimental technique (Culture and aseptic technique)
2. Microscopic and staining technique for morphological characterization
3. Biochemical and PCR test for identification
4. Food and water safety testing methods
5. Symbiosis: Normal flora, pathogenesis of and test for dental caries, life cycle of plasmodium, root nodules formation, and finally a taste of yogurt making
6.Different antimicrobials, sterilization and disinfection techniques, how to test their efficacy and how do they work.
7. Virology, cytopathic effects, serological tests for the diagnosis of viral infection and titer determination, one-step infection test for the determination of burst size and latent period
reviews.comment_teaching: Since it is a small class, the teaching quality will essentially be higher. Although Dr. Hung speaks slowly sometimes, he is a kind and responsible teacher that he will respond to every question a student ask sincerely. He is also a good friend to students (me) despite the age gap.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading is employed:
>90% A+
>85% A
>80% A-
same pattern goes on

The grading reflects a student hard work and ability directly and so it is very fair.
Assessment:
Lab report x 4 (must include the project report):40%
Lab skill (mainly assessed during project): 20%
Final exam:40%
As you can see, the project is a pretty important contributor to the final grade. Also, the project is rather easy and so make sure that you do not lose track before the project and a lot of easy marks will be in your pocket.

Many of my friends got A range and I myself got an A+. I am not sure about the mean but it should be around B+ to A- and so it is pretty easy to get A range if you are not too lazy.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite heavy. Except the project report, my other three reports all record a more than 3000 words length. Some students even wrote 5000 words according to Dr. Hung and so expect your report to be dwarfed if you do not research much. However, the report can still score a high mark if you write it in a concise and logically coherent manner (me).
